result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Krista M. Smith

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Krista M. Smith in court.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Walmart Kenosha County

2:02 PM
Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am. $1000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). ec
and witness list filed by the State
